DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study determine whether MEMS® cap LCD reader ( `` smart '' cap ) along additional patient counsel intervention ( Arm 3 ) improve adherence dimethyl fumarate ( DMF ) treatment MS patient compare MEMS ( Medication Event Monitoring System ) cap without LCD reader ( `` standard '' cap ) patient counsel intervention ( standard care , Arm 1 ) Month 12 . The secondary objective study study population : To determine data display smart MEMS cap LCD reader ( Arm 2 ) improve adherence compare standard MEMS cap without LCD reader ( Arm 1 ) Month 12 ; To determine whether addition patient counsel intervention base MEMS data ( Arm 3 ) , data display MEMS cap LCD reader ( Arm 2 ) improve adherence compare standard MEMS cap without LCD reader ( Arm 1 ) Month 6 ; To assess persistence compliance Months 6 12 arm ; To assess association adherence patient report outcomes ( PROs ) arm include Multiple Sclerosis Impact Scale ( MSIS-29 ) , Work Productivity Activity Impairment Questionnaire ( WPAI ) : MS v2.0 .
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluate Whether Medication Event Monitoring System ( MEMS ) Can Improve Adherence Tecfidera Treatment Multiple Sclerosis Patients .
DOC.criteria: Key The candidate DMFnaïve patient Have diagnosis relapse form MS satisfy approve therapeutic indication DMF Have recent ( i.e. , within previous 6 month ) complete blood count result preclude patient 's participation study , judgment Investigator Key Have comorbid condition preclude participation study , determine Investigator History severe allergic anaphylactic reaction know drug hypersensitivity Are participate , plan participate , participate Tecfidera QuickStart Program NOTE : Other protocol define Inclusion/Exclusion criterion may apply
